tweet: People often complain that the Ethereum narrative "keeps changing". This is false. Rather, the Ethereum narrative is inherently pluralist, containing bets that at least one of many kinds of applications will grow and prosper.

@udiWertheimer I'd recommend breaking it up into two questions:  1. Why is Ethereum better than a single-node ETH private chain run as a hypothetical new Google service? 2. Why is a single-node ETH private chain run by Google better than Google Spreadsheets?  I presume you care more about (1)?
Can you run an ethereum full node through Tor? No.  Will this be an issue? Yes.

@udiWertheimer GoogThereum has 3 risks that Ethereum doesn't:  1. GoogThereum may censor or interfere with your application because of pressure from the USA gov 2. GoogThereum may censor... because of Google's strategic interests 3. GoogThereum may get hacked or otherwise break involuntarily
